ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An applied_area is a type of
that is the representation of the bounded enclosed area used in the definition of the
and
feature_definitions.
A
is defined in ISO 10303-1814 [5] and defines the requirement for applied_area.
The applied_area shall be an aspect of the shape of a .
The applied_area shall have its implicit representation specified by exactly one .
The applied_area shall have an implicit representation that contains at least two and at most three representation_items in its set of .

The implicit representation of an applied_area shall contain only representation_items in its set
of either 'orientation', 'effective length', or 'maximum length'.

Exactly one
used for the implicit representation of the applied_area shall be of type
and
with a
of 'effective length'.

At most one
used for the implicit representation of the applied_area shall be of type
and
with a
of 'maximum length'.

Exactly one
used for the implicit representation of the applied_area shall be of type
with a
of 'orientation'.

When applied to a , the
with
of 'effective length' defines the overall length of the .

A boss is a type of
that is an enclosed shape protrusion with a reference location and position. A boss shall be circular, rectangular, or complex.
A
is defined in ISO 10303-1814 [5] and defines the requirement for boss.

The
for the boss shall be either 'circular', 'complex', or 'rectangular'.

The boss shall be the basis shape for exactly one
with a
of 'boss height occurrence' that is the
in exactly one
with a
of 'boss height' and a
of 'path feature component usage' in which the
is a
with a
of 'linear'.
The implicit representation of the boss shall contain between one and two representation_items.

The implicit representation of the boss shall contain only representation_items that have a
of either 'orientation', or 'fillet radius'.

The implicit representation of the boss shall have at most one
of type
and
with a
of 'fillet radius'.

If the boss has a
of 'circular' the boss shall be the basis shape for exactly one
with a
of 'circular profile occurrence' that is the
in exactly one
with a
of 'profile usage' in which the
is a .

The boss shall be the basis shape for exactly one
with a
of 'top condition occurrence' that is the
in exactly one
with a
of 'boss top usage' in which the
is a .

The boss shall be the basis shape for at most one
with a
of 'change in diameter occurrence' that is the
in exactly one
with a
of 'taper usage' in which the
is a .

If the boss has a
of 'complex', the boss shall be the basis shape for exactly one
with a
of 'enclosed boundary occurrence' that is the
in exactly one
with a
of 'profile usage' in which the
is either a , or .

If the boss has a
of 'complex' or 'rectangular', the boss shall be the basis shape for at most one
with a
of 'change in boundary occurrence' that is the
in exactly one
with a
of 'taper usage' in which the
is a
with a
of 'angle taper' or 'directed taper'.

If the boss has a
of 'rectangular', the boss shall be the basis shape for exactly one
with a
of 'rectangular profile occurrence' that is the
in exactly one
with a
of 'profile usage' in which the
is a .

The boss shall have at most one
with a
of 'maximum feature limit'.
The location shall be defined at the top of the boss at the approximate center of the feature.
The boss may be positioned on the face of a part with the Z-axis in the direction away from the part, or at the top of the Boss with the Z-axis in the direction of the part face.

The location, X direction, and Y direction of the
with a
of 'boss height' shall be the same as the boss.

The placement of the
that defines the diameter of a boss with a
of 'circular' shall be with the origin, X direction, and Y direction equal to that of the boss.

The placement of the , , or
that defines the shape of a boss with a
of 'complex' shall be with the origin, X direction, and Y direction equal to that of the boss.

A boss_top is a type of
that is the end condition for a
.
A
is defined in ISO 10303-1814 [5], and defines the requirement for boss_top.
The boss_top shall be an aspect of the shape of a .

The
of the boss_top shall be either 'planar' or 'complex'.

If the
of the boss_top is 'planar', the boss_top shall have exactly one .

If the
of the boss_top is 'planar', the boss_top shall have exactly one .

If the
of the boss_top is 'complex', the boss_top shall have exactly one .

The boss_top shall be the
in at least one
with a
of 'boss top usage' and a
of either 'boss height start' or 'boss height end' in which the
is a
of a
with a
of 'top condition occurrence'.

The boss_top shall have at most one
to specify its implicit representation.
The boss_top shall be represented implicitly by exactly one .

The implicit representation of the boss_top shall have at most one
of type
and
with a
of 'top radius'.

The location of the boss_top shall be at the center of the face that is the mating face to a
feature.

The boss_top shall be defined on the mating face in the X-Y plane with the Z direction coincident to that of the mating
feature.

A chamfer is a type of
that is the representation of a linear transition between two shape_aspects. A chamfer defines the outside profile of a part.
A
is defined in ISO 10303-1814 [5], and defines the requirement for chamfer.

The chamfer shall have at most one
in the role of the chamfer face.

The chamfer shall be related to exactly one
that specifies the first offset for the chamfer.

The chamfer shall be related to exactly one
that specifies the second offset for the chamfer.

A chamfer_offset is a type of
that is the representation of the linear setbacks from the edge of two surfaces to create a
.
A
and a
are defined in ISO 10303-1814 [5] and define the requirement for chamfer_offset.

The
for the chamfer_offset shall be either 'first offset' or 'second offset'.
The chamfer_offset shall have its implicit representation specified by exactly one .

The chamfer_offset shall have an implicit representation that contains exactly one
in its set of .

If the
of the chamfer_offset is 'first offset', exactly one
used for the implicit representation of the chamfer_offset shall be of type
and
with a
of 'offset amount'.

If the
of the chamfer_offset is 'first offset', the chamfer_offset shall have at most one
with a
of 'first face shape'.

If the
of the chamfer_offset is 'second offset', exactly one
used for the implicit representation of the chamfer_offset shall be either of type
and
with a
of 'offset amount', or of type
and
with a
of 'offset angle'.

If the
of the chamfer_offset is 'second offset', the chamfer_offset shall have at most one
with a
of 'second face shape'.

The chamfer_offset shall be the
in at exactly one
in which the
is a .

A circular_closed_profile is a type of
that is an enclosed 2D area defined by a radius, with orientation and location. The location is defined to be at the center of the circular arc, and the orientation of the circular_closed_profile is the X-Y plane.
A
is defined in ISO 10303-1814 [5] and defines the requirement for circular_closed_profile.
The circular_closed_profile shall be an aspect of the shape of a .
The circular_closed_profile shall have exactly one implicit representation defined by a relationship to a .

The
that represents the circular_closed_profile shall contain two representation_items in its set of .

Exactly one
used for the implicit representation of a circular_closed_profile shall be of type
with a
of 'orientation'.

Exactly one
used the implicit representation of a circular_closed_profile shall be of type
and
with a
of 'diameter'.
The location of the circular_closed_profile shall be defined at the center of the circle.
The circular_closed_profile shall be definied in the X-Y plane.

A circular_pattern is a type of
that relates a base feature and one or more shape_aspects which are the placement of the base feature at a specified circular location on the base part. A diameter is defined with a placement on the part and a number of base features are equally spaced around this diameter.
A
is defined in ISO 10303-1814 [5] and defines the requirement for circular_pattern.

The circular_pattern shall be the
in no more than three shape_aspect_relationships.
The circular_pattern shall have exactly one implicit representation.
The implicit representation of the circular_pattern shall contain between two and five representation_items in its set of .

The implicit representation of the circular_pattern shall contain at most one
of type
and
with a
of 'diameter'.

The implicit representation of the circular_pattern shall contain at most one
of type
and
with a
of 'base feature rotation'.

The implicit representation of the circular_pattern shall contain exactly one
of type
with a
of type
and a
of 'number of features'.

The implicit representation of the circular_pattern shall contain exactly one
of type
and
with a
of 'angular spacing'.

The implicit representation of the circular_pattern shall contain exactly one
of type
with a
of 'orientation'.
The location of the circular_pattern shall be defined at the center of the circle.
The circular_pattern shall be defined in the X-Y plane, with the X direction intersecting the placement position of the first base feature.

A closed_path_profile is a type of
that is a closed two dimensional area defined by a connected set of curves with a location and orientation. The start vertex and end vertex for the set of curves are the same point creating an enclosed area. The closed_path_profile is located at the approximate center of the enclosed area, and the orientation is in the X-Y plane.
A
is defined in ISO 10303-1814 [5] and defines the requirement for closed_path_profile.
The closed_path_profile shall be an aspect of the shape of a .
The closed_path_profile shall have exactly one implicit representation defined by a relationship to a .

The
that represents the closed_path_profile shall contain one representation_items in its set of .

Exactly one
used for the implicit representation of a closed_path_profile shall be of type
with a
of 'orientation'.
The closed_path_profile shall have exactly one .
The location of the closed_path_profile shall be defined at the approximate center of the enclosed area.
The closed_path_profile shall be defined in the X-Y plane.

A composite_hole is a type of
that is the representation of two round_holes for the purpose of creating two commonly used
combinations, the countersunk hole and the counterbore hole. The counterbore hole is the representation of two round_holes with one having a larger diameter than the second. The countersunk hole is the representation of two round_holes, the first having a larger diameter than the second with a linear decrease in diameter until it is the same as the second. This linear decrease shall be represented by a .
A
and a
are defined in ISO 10303-1814 [5] and define the requirement for composite_hole.

The
of the composite_hole shall be either 'counterbore' or 'countersunk'.

The composite_hole shall be the
in exactly two instances of
with a
of type .

If the
of the composite_hole is 'countersunk', exactly one
that comprises it shall be a tapered hole.
Each round_holes that comprise the composite_hole shall not have diameters that are equal in length.

A compound_feature is a type of
that is the representation of several instanced_features and their relationships to one another for the purpose of creating unique user defined features.

The
of the compound_feature shall be 'compound feature in solid'.

Each instance of compound_feature shall have a shape that has exactly one
identified on it that is of type .

The shape_aspect_relationships that are used to relate the single features with the
shall be feature_component_relationships.

The
defining a compound_feature shall be the
only in shape_aspect_relationships.

ext_description.p:
The
defining a compound_feature shall be the
only in shape_aspect_relationships with a
that is not of type .
ext_description.note:
A
feature can not be directly related to a compound_feature. The
of the
is related to a compound_feature.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The compound_feature shall only have constituent compound_features of the same type.

A direction_shape_representation is a type of
that represents a direction vector in two or three dimensional space.

The direction_shape_representation shall have exactly one
in its set of .
The geometric element that is used to represent the direction_shape_representation shall be a .

An edge_round is a type of
that is the representation of a circular convex transition between two shape_aspects. An edge_round defines the outside profile of a part.
An
and a
are defined in ISO 10303-1814 [5] and define the requirement for edge_round.

An edge_round has an implicit representation if and only if it has a
of 'constant radius'.

If the
of the edge_round is 'constant radius', the implicit representation shall contain at least one and at most three representation_items in its set of .

If the
of the edge_round is 'constant radius', exactly one
used for the implicit representation of the edge_round shall be of type
and
with a
of 'radius'.

If the
of the edge_round is 'constant radius', at most one
used for the implicit representation of the edge_round shall be of type
and
with a
of 'first offset'.

If the
of the edge_round is 'constant radius', at most one
used for the implicit representation of the edge_round shall be of type
and
with a
of 'second offset'.

The edge_round shall have at most one
with a
of 'edge round face'.

The edge_round shall have at most one
with a
of 'first face shape'.

The edge_round shall have at most one
with a
of 'second face shape'.

An externally_defined_feature_definition is a type of
and a type of . An externally_defined_feature_definition relates the document containing a feature specification to a .
A , a , a
and a
are defined in ISO 10303-1814 [5] and define the requirements for externally_defined_feature_definition.
Local rules for externally_defined_feature_definition define constrained usage for , defined in ISO 10303-1127 [y], , and , defined in ISO 10303-1122 [y]. Similar entities are defined in non-modlar application protocol using this part of ISO 10303. See Annex E for additional information.

If the
of the externally_defined_feature_definition is 'thread', then the
is 'external thread', and the
of the
referenced by the
of the externally_defined_feature_definition is 'external feature specification'.
If the
of the externally_defined_feature_definition is 'marking', then the
is 'external marking', and the
of the
referenced by the
of the externally_defined_feature_definition is 'external feature specification'.
If the
of the externally_defined_feature_definition is 'knurl', then the
is 'external knurl', and the
of the
referenced by the
of the externally_defined_feature_definition is 'external feature specification'.
If the

is 'external gear', and the
of the
referenced by the
of the externally_defined_feature_definition is 'external feature specification'.

If the

in its set of .

with a
of 'partial area occurrence' that is the
in at most one
with a
of 'applied area usage' in which the
is an .

with a
of 'marking text'.

If the
of the externally_defined_feature_definition is 'thread', then exactly one

with a
of 'removal direction' and a
of either 'internal' or 'external'.

If the

used for the implicit representation of the externally_defined_feature_definition shall be of type
with a
of 'qualifier'.

If the

of 'hand'.

of 'fit class'.

If the
of the externally_defined_feature_definition is 'thread', exactly one

with a
of 'form'.

If the

and
with a
of 'major diameter'.

If the

used for the implicit representation of the externally_defined_feature_definition shall be of type
and
with a
of 'number of threads'.

If the

with a
of 'fit class 2'.

If the
of the externally_defined_feature_definition is 'thread', at most one

with a
of 'nominal size'.

If the
of the externally_defined_feature_definition is 'marking', 'gear' or 'thread' there shall be the basis shape for exactly one

is a .

If the

If the

If the
of the

A face_shape_representation is a type of
that represents geometry defined by a portion of an associated surface.

The face_shape_representation shall have one or more
in its set of .
The geometric element that is used to represent the face_shape_representation shall be a , .

A feature_component_definition is a type of
that is used as a constituent of a preconceived form pattern.

The feature_component_definition shall be the item for which exactly one
is defined.

A feature_component_relationship is a type of
in which the
is an implicitly represented component, such as a , of the .
A Chamfer may have the implicit chamfer offset amount defined with a feature_component_relationship and the explicit geometry for the chamfer defined with a .
A feature_component_relationship may be either a
or a .

The
referenced as the
shall be of type , , , or
or shall be an aspect of the shape of a
or a .

A feature_pattern is a type of
that relates a base feature and one or more shape_aspects which are the placement of the base feature at a specified location on the base part.

The implicit representation of a feature_pattern shall only contain representation_items in its set of
that are of type .

The feature_pattern shall have an implicit representation defined by a
which contains one or more representation_items in its set of
of type
with the
of 'base feature placement'.

A fillet is a type of
that is the representation of a circular concave transition between two shape_aspects. A fillet defines the outside profile of a part.
A
and a
are defined in ISO 10303-1814 [5] and define the requirement for fillet.

A fillet has an implicit representation if and only if it has a
of 'constant radius'.

If the
of the fillet is 'constant radius', the implicit representation shall contain at least one and at most three representation_items in its set of .

If the
of the fillet is 'constant radius', exactly one
used for the implicit representation of the fillet shall be of type
and
with a
of 'radius'.

If the
of the fillet is 'constant radius', at most one
used for the implicit representation of the fillet shall be of type
and
with a
of 'first offset'.

If the
of the fillet is 'constant radius', at most one
used for the implicit representation of the fillet shall be of type
and
with a
of 'second offset'.

The fillet shall have exactly one
with a
of 'fillet face'.

The fillet shall have exactly one
with a
of 'first face shape'.

The fillet shall have exactly one
with a
of 'second face shape'.

A flat_face is a type of
that is the representation of a volume that is removed from the base shape. This removal shall be planar and representation shall be a
moving along a linear .
A
is defined in ISO 10303-1814 [5] and defines the requirement for flat_face.

The flat_face shall have exactly one
with a
of 'removal direction'.

The flat_face shall be the basis shape for exactly one
with a
of 'course of travel occurrence' that is the
in exactly one
with a
of 'path feature component usage' and a
of 'course of travel' and a
that references a
with a
of 'linear'.

The flat_face shall be the basis shape for exactly one
with a
of 'removal boundary occurrence' that is the
in exactly one
with a
of 'profile usage' and a
of 'removal boundary' and a
that references a .

The flat_face shall be the basis shape for at most one
with a
of 'enclosed boundary occurrence' that is the
in exactly one
with a
of 'profile usage' and a
of 'boundary' and a
that references a , , , or .

The flat_face shall have at most one
with a
of 'maximum feature limit'.

The flat_face shall have the uncut volume defined by exactly one
that is referenced by zero or more
with
of 'uncut volume' through the
attribute that references a
through the
attribute that references either a
or a .

The implicit representation of the flat_face shall have at most one
of type
and
with a
of 'removal depth'.
The location of the flat_face shall be defined at one of the corners of the removal volume.
The direction of volume removal of the flat_face shall be in the Z direction.

The origin, X direction, and Y direction of the
shall be equal to that of the flat_face.
The origin, X direction, Y direction of the flat_face shall be equal to that of the .

A gear is a type of
that is the representation of a gear shape that is applied to all or a portion of a .
A
is defined in ISO 10303-1814 [5] and defines the requirement for gear.
The implicit representation of the gear shall contain between ten and thirteen representation_items.

Exactly one
used for the implicit representation of the gear shall be of type
and
with a
of 'number of teeth'.

Exactly one
used for the implicit representation of the gear shall be of type
and
with a
of 'reference pressure angle'.

Exactly one
used for the implicit representation of the gear shall be of type
and
with a
of 'profile shift'.

Exactly one

and
with a
of 'nominal tooth depth'.

Exactly one
used for the implicit representation of the gear shall be of type
and
with a
of 'face width'.

Exactly one

and
with a
of 'tip diameter'.

Exactly one

with a
of 'module or diametral pitch' and a
of either 'module' or 'diametral pitch'.

Exactly one
used for the implicit representation of the gear shall be of type
with a
of 'internal or external gear' and a
of either 'internal ' or 'external pitch'.

Exactly one
used for the implicit representation of the gear shall be of type
and
with a
of 'normal attribute'.

Either zero or one
used for the implicit representation of the gear shall be of type
and
with a
of 'root fillet radius'.

If the gear has a

If the gear has a

If the gear has a

with a

If the gear has a

with a
of 'tip angle'.

Exactly gear gear shall be the basis shape for exactly one
that is the
in at most one
with a
of 'applied shape' in which the
is a .
The location of the gear shall be at a distance from the end of a cylindrical face, and on the axis of the cylindrical face.
The Z direction of the gear shall be in the direction of the center axis of the cylindrical face.

A hole_bottom is a type of
that is the representation of the end condition for a hole .
A
and a
are defined in ISO 10303-1814 [5] and define the requirement for hole_bottom.
The hole_bottom shall be an aspect of the shape of a .

The
of the hole_bottom shall be either 'through', 'flat', 'flat with radius', 'flat with taper', 'spherical', or 'conical'.

If the
of the hole_bottom is 'through', the hole_bottom shall not have any representation.

If the
of the hole_bottom is 'flat with radius', 'spherical', or 'conical', the hole_bottom shall have exactly one
to specify its implicit representation.

If the
of the hole_bottom is 'flat', the hole_bottom shall be represented implicitly by exactly zero .

If the
of the hole_bottom is 'flat with radius' or 'spherical', the hole_bottom shall be represented implicitly by exactly one .

If the
of the hole_bottom is 'flat with taper', the hole_bottom shall be represented implicitly by exactly two representation_items.

If the
of the hole_bottom is 'conical', the hole_bottom shall be represented implicitly by at least one and at most two representation_items.

If the
of the hole_bottom is not 'through', the
that refers to it, shall have a
of either 'hole depth start' or 'hole depth end'.

If the
of the hole_bottom is 'flat with radius', the implicit representation of the hole_bottom shall have exactly one
in its
set which is a
and
with a
of 'corner radius'.

If the
of the hole_bottom is 'spherical', the implicit representation of the hole_bottom shall have exactly one
in its
set which is a
and
with a
of 'radius'.

If the
of the hole_bottom is 'conical', the implicit representation of the hole_bottom shall have at most one
in its
set which is a
and
with a
of 'tip radius'.

If the
of the hole_bottom is 'conical', the implicit representation of the hole_bottom shall have exactly one
in its
set which is a
and
with a
of 'tip angle'.

The hole_bottom shall be the
in at least one
with a
of 'hole bottom usage' in which the
is an aspect of the shape of a
with a

A rectangular_closed_profile is a type of
that represents an enclosed 2D area with location and orientation. The enclosed area is defined by four straight sides with opposite sides equal in length. The location is defined to be at the center of the rectangle, and the orientation of the rectangular_closed_profile is the X-Y plane with the X direction along the length of the rectangle and the Y direction orthogonal to the X direction in the direction of the width.
A
is defined in ISO 10303-1814 [5] and defines the requirement for rectangular_closed_profile.
The rectangular_closed_profile shall be an aspect of the shape of a .
The rectangular_closed_profile shall have exactly one implicit representation defined by a relationship to a .

The
that represents the rectangular_closed_profile shall contain at least three and at most four representation_items in its set of .

The implicit representation of a rectangular_closed_profile shall contain only representation_items in its set of
with a
of 'orientation', 'length', 'width', and 'corner radius'.

with a
of 'length'.

used for the implicit representation of a rectangular_closed_profile shall be of type
and
with a
of 'corner radius'.
The location of the rectangular_closed_profile shall be defined at the center of the rectangle.

The rectangular_closed_profile shall be defined in the X-Y plane with the length in the X direction and the width in the Y direction of the rectangle. The X direction is orthogonal to the Y direction.

A tee_profile is a type of
which is the representation of an upside down T shape with a location and a position. The tee_profile consist of a stem and a perpendicular cross bar. The stem has two parallel lines connected at their ends by the cross bar. The cross bar is a rectangle. The profile is symmetric about the centerline of the stem. The tee_profile is located at the midpoint of the side of the cross bar opposite the stem, and positioned with the side of the cross bar opposite the stem on the X direction and the profile symmetric with respect to the Y direction.
